intro: Medeola angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf whitebeard, is a herbaceous perennial native to eastern North America. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, grass-like foliage and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and has a rhizomatous root system that allows it to spread vegetatively. Its leaves are narrow and have a distinctive waxy coating, while its flowers bloom in early spring before the leaves fully expand. Medeola angustifolia is also known for its historical use in traditional medicine by Indigenous peoples.
